page.title: 07 KETTERING MARKET
page.content: The Market is a very busy place. It is the busiest on Saturdays. Kettering Market owes it foundation to a charter granted in 1227 by Henry 111 to Peterborough Monastery allowing a Market to be held at Kettering.Most people who work on the Market come from Leicester and from Kettering.The most popular stall sells fruit and vegetables.There are also stalls selling clothes,shoes,sweets,hosiery, flowers,fabrics,records,household goods and dairy produce.The Market is held every Friday and Saturday.There is no Market on Good Friday. On a Wednesday there is an antique market. There is always a busy atmosphere with people rushing about.Some stall holders stand quietly waiting for somebody to buy their goods.
